abstract: Federal prosecutors ask District Court Judge Katherine B Forrest to impose sentence 'substantially above the mandatory minimum' for Ross W Ulbricht, founder of website Silk Road, who has been convicted on charges including distributing narcotics on Internet and engaging in continuing criminal enterprise, for which maximum sentence is life in prison; defense argues for mandatory minimum sentence of 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors, asking for a sentence much longer than 20 years, blamed Mr. Ulbricht for overdoses and addiction resulting from an “online black market of unprecedented scope.”

headline.main: Long Sentence Sought for Silk Road Creator Ross Ulbricht
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Seek Long Prison Term for Creator of Illicit-Drug Website

snippet: Prosecutors, asking for a sentence much longer than 20 years, blamed Mr. Ulbricht for overdoses and addiction resulting from an “online black market of unprecedented scope.”
